similaranime.anime: Meitantei Conan: Kara Kurenai no Love Letter

recommendations.recommendation:
Far away from Hikaru no Go...
I cant remember anymore when madhouse produced something I liked...
This awesome anime is worth your time, I was in doubt when I started to watch it for the first time, but then ... I felt like I was part of this beautiful story.
Recommended if you liked Hikaru No Go, or if you`ve enjoyed sports anime or anime about high school clubs.

If you`re into Hikaru no Go and similiar anime then this is definetly for you. I loved it. Got hooked right from the start. Can`t wait for the 2nd season. Totally recommended.
and Chihaya is awesome. :D

Whoever thought that obscure sports were boring might want to reconsider after having watched Hikaru no Go. For all the people who could appreciate that show, Chihayafuru might be your cup of tea as well. Not as good as HnG, but nevertheless entertaining enough to keep you watching.
One of my all time favorites. Great story and character development. You really fall in love with everyone in the story. Even the flashbacks are well done and timed perfectly

The anime is very good, if you are looking for a different proposal and "autoral" in a way this anime was made for you. The anime has its development but always shows what will be its focus. It is not made up of great arts or exceptional movements but it has its value and knows how to enjoy well that scene should be very lively or not. But what really made me continue and what I learned from him, a game that can be "boring" but becomes something fun and competitive and that in every competition there is someone better or who can "fight" on an equal basis and author knew how to explore these scenes well ...

anime.description: * Based on a manga written and illustrated by http://anidb.net/cr28499 [Suetsugu Yuki], serialised in Be Love and published by http://anidb.net/cr748 [Kodansha]. 6th-year grade-schooler http://anidb.net/ch35739 [Ayase Chihaya`s] dream is for her sister to be Japan`s top model. However, transfer student http://anidb.net/ch35741 [Wataya Arata] admonishes her that a dream must be about one`s own self. Thus, she takes up karuta, a Japanese card game, competitively. Together with Arata and http://anidb.net/ch35740 [Mashima Taichi], Chihaya`s childhood friend, they have great fun playing each other, but separate after graduation. 4 years later, Chihaya returns to town. Although Arata no longer plays the game, she believes that they will eventually reunite as long as she continues karuta. Together with Taichi, she establishes the Mizusawa High-school Karuta Club. ~ translated and adapted from official site by Cranston

tag.name: maintenance tags
tag.description: These tags are used for maintenance.

tag.name: transfer student
tag.description: A transfer student is a student who changes from one institution or course to another at the same level. Their arrival, when not at the beginning of the school year, tends to cause a stir.

tag.name: high school
tag.description: A secondary school that usually contains grades 10 through 12 in Japan, or 9 through 12 in America.

tag.name: karuta
tag.description: Karuta (かるた, loaned from the Portuguese word meaning "card", carta) is a Japanese card game. The basic idea of any karuta game is to be able to quickly determine which card out of an array of cards is required and then to grab the card before it is grabbed by an opponent. There are various types of cards which can be used to play karuta. It is also possible to play this game using two standard decks of playing cards. There are two kinds of cards used in karuta. One kind is yomifuda (読札) or "reading cards", and the other is torifuda (取り札) or "grabbing cards". As they were denoted, the words in the yomifuda are read and players will have to find its associated torifuda before anybody else does.

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: josei
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, the word josei refers to a female audience roughly between the ages of 15 and 44. In Japanese, the word means simply "woman", and has no anime/manga-related connotations at all. It does not comprise a style or a genre per se, but rather indicates the publisher`s intended target demographic.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: school clubs
tag.description: Even though school clubs in Japan are not mandatory, there is some pressure from the social grid (e.g. fellow students, teachers) to participate in some kind of after-school activity, be it in sports or arts. Colleges also have clubs. As a comedy element in anime, some students have joined too many clubs, and are thus constantly stressed out. There is also the element of social commentary, making it clear that you have to join a club, if you want to be part of the class. Since self-founded clubs need at least 3 members, the desperate search and advertising for new members can be cause for hilarity in anime.

tag.name: Japan
tag.description: Japan is a sovereign island nation in East Asia. Located in the Pacific Ocean, it lies off the eastern coast of the Asian mainland and stretches from the Sea of Okhotsk in the north to the East China Sea and China in the southwest. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: unrequited love
tag.description: At least one character has a romantic interest in another one, but the feelings are not returned. This is the cornerstone of all love triangles or love polygons.

tag.name: plot continuity
tag.description: Consistency of the characteristics of persons, plot, objects, places and events seen by the viewer. A single linear focused plot is highly continuous. A truly random plot is highly discontinuous.

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: Asia
tag.description: Asia is Earth`s largest and most populous continent, located primarily in the eastern and northern hemispheres and sharing the continental landmass of Eurasia with the continent of Europe. Asia covers an area of 44,579,000 square kilometers, about 30% of Earth`s total land area and 8.7% of the Earth`s total surface area. The continent, which has long been home to the majority of the human population, was the site of many of the first civilizations. Asia is notable for not only its overall large size and population, but also dense and large settlements as well as vast barely populated regions within the continent of 4.4 billion people. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: romance
tag.description: Romance describes a story that deals with love between two or more characters typically also having an optimistic ending. Romance is also a difficulty encountered when creating a harem.

tag.name: school life
tag.description: Since a large part of the anime audience still takes part in school life or is visiting college, it is only natural to choose a setting the audience can identify with, be it elementary, middle, or high school. For the older viewers a college setting with more mature real-life problems is appropriate. And since clubs take up so much time in the lives of students, these are obviously also important.

tag.name: sports
tag.description: Sports anime revolves around a recreational physical activity or skill. In addition they often adhere to certain genre conventions, the emphasis on training and practice in preparation for competition, characters desire for self improvement, and pursuit of a specific goal.

tag.name: coming of age
tag.description: In the strict sense the Coming of age describes a young person`s transition from adolescence to adulthood. In anime the term is used in a more general sense where the protagonists have to face a challenge, make an important decision in their life, take on responsibility, or learn a lesson, and by overcoming these obstacles they reach a higher level of maturity.

tag.name: unsorted
tag.description: a bunch of tags that still need to be either deleted or moved into proper places.

tag.name: aim for the top
tag.description: This can be a positive or negative plot device. A character may strive to become the best in an altruistic way (e.g. best healer, most widely learned master), or it can be quite banal and primitive (e.g. challenged delinquents wanting to be the strongest fighters). Alas in fighting anime the latter usually prevails.

tag.name: bullying
tag.description: Bullying is the use of force, threat, or coercion to abuse, intimidate, or aggressively dominate others. One who engages in bullying is known as a bully. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: training
tag.description: Training is extensive, serious practising a person undergoes in order to develop skills and abilities, such as handling weapons, playing instruments, playing sports, and so on.

tag.name: competition
tag.description: Some sort of confrontation occurs in this show. The protagonists "duke it out" via various competitions.

tag.name: talking is a free action
tag.description: Time in comics is flexible. Each panel shows a single event, which is usually accompanied by a length of dialog, which must take some time to say. This disparity is usually accepted if it isn`t taken to extremes. But often, characters will exposit when it`s most needed: at the story`s climax, when both the intricacies of the plot and the intensity of action hit their highest. While the Heroes Outrun the Fireball, Mr. Exposition might explain why the Evil Overlord`s death caused the explosion. The Action Girl can deliver impressive lectures on why the monster`s Achilles` Heel will work, while still engaging in Waif-Fu. The Superhero can quip to his heart`s content and explain his abilities while dueling one insignificant mobster, or deliver a Kirk Summation during the course of a single Finishing Move. Sometimes even apparent mere mortals can give a lecture on what is happening when it would be a much better idea to simply run like hell. Without stopping to breathe, apparently. Source: TvTrope

tag.name: nostalgia
tag.description: A bitter-sweet longing for things, persons, or situations from the past.

tag.name: hard work and guts
tag.description: One of the character`s motto in the anime. Because there is nothing that cannot be achieved by hard work and guts.

tag.name: Hyakunin Isshu
tag.description: A traditional anthology style of compiling Japanese waka poetry where each contributor writes one poem for the anthology. Literally, it translates to "one hundred people, one poem". It also refers to the card game of uta-garuta, which uses a deck composed of poems from one such anthology.

tag.name: flashback
tag.description: A flashback is a moment in which someone remembers events from their past. In fiction, flashbacks are used primarily to give insight into a character`s mind or to reveal information which had been previously kept from the audience. They normally consist essentially of new content; in some cases, they may also consist of short snippets of already displayed content, as in http://anidb.net/ch23266 [Okabe Rintarou]`s flashbacks in http://anidb.net/a7729 [Steins;Gate], but even in these cases the flashbacks are used to look into what the character is thinking. As such, they are different from and should not be confused with recaps, which are old content being shown again for no particular purpose other than padding or reminding the audience of the events up to that point. As a rule of thumb, to qualify as a flashback, the scene must advance the show`s content in some way or form; anything else is just a recap.

tag.name: motivational anime
tag.description: The anime motivates doing something which is shown in the show (for example club activity, sports, choosing a job, a hobby etc).

tag.name: following one`s dream
tag.description: No matter what the hardships may be, at least one of the protagonists in this anime is following her/his dream. Examples: To become a professional athlete, a musician, a painter or the ruler of this world!

tag.name: intact family
tag.description: The main character`s family is a so-called "nuclear family". Wherein both parents are alive and present in his or her life. This is actually relatively rare for anime, where "parental abandonment" is the norm.

tag.name: rivalry
tag.description: Quite broadly used term describing a conflict, contest, struggle, or opposition of some sort. Typical examples: The mostly comedic rivalry for the love of a protagonist in a harem anime (love polygon), the more "mindless" battles between wannabe delinquents in a school fighting anime, or the struggle between good & evil in an epic conflict for world domination.

tag.name: female protagonist
tag.description: The anime has a female protagonist.

tag.name: manly tears
tag.description: Somewhere down the line, it became the "norm" that boys don`t cry. The scenario does not matter; shedding tears is the ultimate no-no in terms of what you can and cannot do as a man (at least in the West, anyway). But there comes a time when a man`s emotions do get the better of him, and they pour forth - as prerequisite an impassioned speech may or may not be present - by cascading down his cheeks. These are what we like to call "manly tears". Extremely powerful. Not limited but often used in hot-blooded / super robot shows. Examples include Yuusha Ou GaoGaiGar, Getter Robo and Tengen Toppa Gurren Lagann. The opposite of manly tears are "girly tears".

tag.name: girly tears
tag.description: Usually girly tears are the ones not shed by men (duh). Like when a (stereotypical) girl watches something and cries her makeup out, a (stereotypical) dude just says, proclaiming his masculinity: "Meh, yet another soap opera bulls..t, I`ll be in my garage fixing my ride while playing heavy metal on a burning guitar ...with my teeth! And where`s my beer, woman?". So that`s how it goes: girly tears are for girls and sissies! Chuck Norris forbid a guy would weep watching something that has this tag! Now 20 push-ups! P.S. The opposite of "manly tears". Or is it? Let`s face it - it`s all subjective (and relative, and context-dependent).

tag.name: mundane made awesome
tag.description: Sometimes normal just doesn`t cut it. Eating: you put food in your month and chew. Playing sports: you throw a ball around. You need to make it awesome, no matter how mundane it is. Let`s throw in some gripping orchestral music, lighting changes, different camera angles, something! Don`t write like a man, write like an evil overlord! Exaggerate your expressions and gestures, speak with excessive intonation, and if all else fails, throw in some close-ups, slow motion, and ominous Latin chanting! With practice, even you can turn something like eating chips into an epic battle of light and dark, blinding the viewer with sheer awesomeness. [Source: TV Tropes]

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO EPISODE
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to episode tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what episodes they should be assigned to.

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO CHARACTER
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to character tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what characters they should be assigned to.

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: card games
tag.description: A card game is any game using playing cards as the primary device with which the game is played, be they traditional or game-specific. Countless card games exist, including families of related games (such as poker). A small number of card games played with traditional decks have formally standardized rules, but most are folk games whose rules vary by region, culture, and person. Many games that are not generally placed in the family of card games do in fact use cards for some aspect of their gameplay. Similarly, some games that are placed in the card game genre involve a board. The distinction is that the gameplay of a card game primarily depends on the use of the cards by players (the board is simply a guide for scorekeeping or for card placement), while board games (the principal non-card game genre to use cards) generally focus on the players` positions on the board, and use the cards for some secondary purpose.

tag.name: tropes
tag.description: A trope is a commonly recurring literary and rhetorical devices, motifs or clichés in creative works. This use is a broader redefining of a literary trope, the use of figurative language, via word, phrase, or even an image, for artistic effect, such as using a figure of speech. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: tales
tag.description: Tales are stories told time and again and passed down from generation to generation, and some of those show up in anime not just once or twice, but several times.

tag.name: adapted into Japanese movie
tag.description: This anime is a http://anidb.net/t2797 [new original work], and it has been adapted into a Japanese movie. In exceedingly rare instances, a specific episode of a new original work anime can also be adapted.

tag.name: adapted into other media
tag.description: This anime is a http://anidb.net/t2797 [new original work], and it has been adapted into other media formats. In exceedingly rare instances, a specific episode of a new original work anime can also be adapted.

character.name: Ayase Chitose
character.description: Ayase Chitose is Chihaya`s older sister. She works as a model.

character.name: Miyauchi Taeko
character.description: Miyauchi Taeko is a teacher of chemistry at Mizusawa high school. She is the adviser of tennis club and karuta club.

character.name: Tannin no Sensei
character.description: Homeroom teacher at elementary school.

character.name: Wataya Mari
character.description: Wataya Mari is Arata`s mother.

character.name: Mashima Reiko
character.description: Mashima Reiko is Taichi`s mother. Chihaya calls her Mrs. Pressure, because she gets angry if Taichi doesn`t excel at everything.

character.name: Ayase Chieko
character.description: Ayase Chieko is Chihaya`s mother.

character.name: Harada Hideo
character.description: Harada-sensei is in charge of Shiranami Karuta Center.

character.name: Kinashi Hiro
character.description: Kinashi Hiro is a member of Shiranami Karuta Center. He is often called Hyoro.

character.name: Nishida Yuusei
character.description: Nishida Yuusei at elementary school.

character.name: Taichi no Kanojo
character.description: Taichi`s girlfriend.

character.name: Yasuda
character.description: Yasuda is a karuta player who is stuck in class B for three years.

character.name: Wataya Akira
character.description: Wataya Akira is Arata`s father.

character.name: Wataya Hajime
character.description: Wataya Hajime is a grandfather of Arata. He taught Arata how to to play karuta. He also was a Karuta Master.

character.name: Yuu
character.description: Yuu is a girl living next to Arata in Fukui.

character.name: Mashima Rika
character.description: Mashima Rika is Taichi`s sister.

character.name: Sano
character.description: Sano is a member of Tomihara West High School karuta club. She was Ayase`s opponent at prefectural tournament.

character.name: Sudou Akihito
character.description: Sudou Akito is a member of Hokuou Academy karuta club. He was opponent of Ayase at final round of prefectural tournament. A year later he`s a reader (yomite) at final round of Tokyo High School Regionals.

character.name: Kinashi Hiro
character.description: Kinashi Hiro meets with Chihaya and others at prefectural tournament. He is a member of Hokuou Academy karuta club. A year later he`s the opponent of Mashima at final round of Tokyo High School Regionals.

character.name: Tsuboguchi Hiroshi
character.description: Tsuboguchi Hiroshi is a member of Shiranami Karuta Center.

character.name: Takuma
character.description: Takuma is a member of Hokuou Academy karuta club. He was the opponent of Komano at final round of prefectural tournament. A year later he`s again Komano`s opponent at final round of Tokyo High School Regionals.

character.name: Mochida Futoshi
character.description: Mochida Futoshi is a coach of Hokuou Academy karuta club.

character.name: Amakasu Nayuta
character.description: Amakasu Nayuta is a member of Hokuou Academy karuta club. He was opponent of Nishida (Nikuman-kun) at final round of prefectural tournament. A year later he`s Chihaya`s opponent at final round of Tokyo High School Regionals.

character.name: Ryuugasaki
character.description: Ryuugasaki is a member of Hokuou Academy karuta club. He was opponent of Kana-chan at final round of prefectural tournament.

character.name: Ayase Kenji
character.description: Ayase Kenji is Chihaya`s father.

character.name: Yoshioka-sensei
character.description: Yoshioka is one of the tournament at Omi Jingu staff members.

character.name: Kawauchi Shouji
character.description: Kawauchi Shouji is Arata`s classmate from junior high school. He is an A class player of karuta.

character.name: Ooe Rieko
character.description: Ooe Rieko is Kanade`s mother. She owns the shop with traditional clothes which she lends to Mizusawa Karuta club on tournaments because she is a big supporter of them.

character.name: Hanamoto Ruri
character.description: Hanamoto Ruri is Chihaya`s first opponent in individual tournament at Omi Jingu.

character.name: Wakamiya Shinobu
character.description: Wakamiya Shinobu is Chihaya`s second opponent in individual tournament at Omi Jingu. She is the current Queen of Karuta and also the youngest Queen in history.

character.name: Toda
character.description: Toda is Taichi`s opponent at final round of individual tournament at Omi Jingu.

character.name: Shibata-sensei
character.description: Shibata-sensei is a teacher at Mizusawa high school.

character.name: Kuriyama Isami
character.description: Kuriyama-sensei is a president of Fukui Nagumo Society.

character.name: Nishida Yukari
character.description: Nishida`s (Nikuman) sister.

character.name: Kanai Sakura
character.description: Kanai Sakura is Chihaya`s opponent at Saitama tournament. She has 35 years of karuta experience.

character.name: Kanai Tsubaki
character.description: Kanai Tsubaki is a daughter of Kanai Sakura.

character.name: Murao Shin`ichi
character.description: Murao Shin`ichi is a member of Nagumo Society in Fukui. He is A Class player.

character.name: Tachikawa Ririka
character.description: Tachikawa Ririka is a young girl playing karuta. She is called prodigy because she made A Class in fourth grade.

character.name: Kitano-sensei
character.description: Kitano-sensei is a president of Suihoku Society. He doesn`t get on with Harada.

character.name: Yamamoto Yumi
character.description: Yamamoto Yumi is an adult player of Karuta. She is former Queen and member of Suihoku Society.

character.name: Horikawa Michiru
character.description: Horikawa Michiru is Chihaya`s classmate and friend.

character.name: Daisuke
character.description: Daisuke is a member of Nagumo Society in Fukui.

character.name: Wakamiya Shiho
character.description: Wakamiya Shiho is Shinobu`s mother.

character.name: Shinobu no Sobo
character.description: Shinobu`s grandmother.

character.name: Suou Hisashi
character.description: Suou Hisashi is the current Meijin (Master) of Karuta. He began karuta in college and took three years to take the title of Meijin. His favourite food is sweets.

character.name: Ise Daijirou
character.description: Ise Daijirou is a headmaster of Kyouto Myoujo karuta Society.

character.name: Murao Kenta
character.description: Murao Kenta is brother of http://anidb.net/ch43026 [Shin`ichi] and twin brother of http://anidb.net/ch43297 [Yuuta].

character.name: Murao Yuuta
character.description: Murao Kenta is brother of http://anidb.net/ch43026 [Shin`ichi] and twin brother of http://anidb.net/ch43296 [Kenta].

character.name: Yamashiro Kyouko
character.description: Yamashiro Kyouko is a famous yomite and one of a few who can read at Meijin (Master) and Queen tournaments. Current Meijin Suou is a fan of her.

character.name: Takemura Keiichi
character.description: Takemura Keiichi is a challenger of current Meijin Suou. He is a member of Kotoku-in University Karuta Society.

character.name: Wakamiya Shinobu
character.description: Shinobu as she appears in the Queen Match, it seems that she was planning to win a special lucky item by her beloved brand, snowmaru, and bring it in the match so she ate as much ice cream as she could to find the lucky ticket. Though her extra weight seemed to have a negative effect on her speed, she still won the queen match.

character.name: Ousaka Megumu
character.description: Ousaka Megumu is a member of First Akashi Girls` High School karuta club and western representative in last year`s Queen match. She was the opponent of Chihaya at The High School National Ogura Hundred Poems Karuta Championship. She is Class A player.

episode.title: PV
さくやこのはな
Now the Flower Blooms
Saku ya Kono Hana
episode.summary: Sixth grade was when Ayase Chihaya met Wataya Arata, the transfer student from Fukui. The shy and quiet Arata was hiding a surprising talent. He knew how to play the competitive karuta version of Ogura`s Hundred Poets. Chihaya is stunned by the intensity Arata displays when playing karuta. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: からくれなゐに
The Red That Is
Karakurenai ni
episode.summary: Chihaya`s proclamation leads to a showdown between Mashima Taichi and the transfer student Arata, who is being shunned by their class. The stubborn Taichi, who`s upset by how close Chihaya and Arata have gotten, steals Arata`s glasses in the middle of the tournament. Arata, good as he may be, is unable to take cards without his glasses. That is when Chihaya steps in to take his place. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ふれるしらゆき
From the Crystal White Snow
Fureru Shirayuki
episode.summary: Chihaya, Taichi, and Arata visit the local Shiranami Karuta Society and meet the chairman, Harada, and a member who`s their age, Kinashi Hiro (Retro-kun). When Harada sees them playing against Retro-kun in a team Genpei match, he realizes Chihaya`s talent and invites her to join. After Harada tells Chihaya that learning the poems is like making 100 new friends, she begins to realize her own dream. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: Ending 1a
Opening 1a
しつこころなくはなのちるらむ
A Whirlwind of Flower Petals Descends
Shizu Kokoro Naku Hana no Chiruran
episode.summary: Arata returns with his family to Fukui after his grandfather falls ill. The three of them believe that as long as they continue to play karuta, they will be reunited. Now in high school, Chihaya has entered a tournament to qualify for Class A so Taichi will help her start a karuta club. Once Taichi sees how Chihaya is enjoying herself, he finds himself being swayed— Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: よはのつきかな
The Sight of a Midnight Moon
Yowa no Tsuki kana
episode.summary: After Chihaya hears Arata say that he quit playing karuta, she and Taichi make a trip to Arata`s home in Fukui. Once they find Arata, Chihaya is thrilled and suggest that they play karuta together again, but Arata turns her down. He`s no longer the same boy he used to be. So Chihaya tries to learn the truth— Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: けふここのへににほひぬるかな
Now Bloom Inside the Ninefold Palace
Kyou Kokonoe ni Nioi Nuru kana
episode.summary: After Ms. Miyauchi tells Chihaya that she needs five members to start an official club, Chihaya starts recruiting. One day, Oe Kanade, a fan of classical literature whose family owns a traditional clothing store, visits the karuta club. She is shocked by the gap between the elegant karuta of the Imperial Court and competitive karuta. However, Chihaya wants Kanade to realize how fun competitive karuta can be. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ひとこそみえねあきはきにけり
But for Autumn`s Coming
Hito koso Miene Aki wa Kini Keri
episode.summary: Kanade has joined the karuta club as the third member, while Chihaya continues to recruit members. First, she scouts the second-smartest student in their grade, Komano Tsutomu, who happens to be in her class. Chihaya calls him Desktomu-kun. However, he tells her that karuta is just a game and he would rather spend that time studying. Chihaya insists that Desktomu-kun play a game first and she drags him to the clubroom. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: たえてひさしくなりぬれど
The Sounds of the Waterfall
Taete Hisashiku Nari Nuredo
episode.summary: The karuta club only needs one more member to become an official club. Chihaya and the other members continue working to recruit members, but they`re having trouble finding anyone who`s interested in joining. But then one day, Chihaya runs into Porky, her old opponent from back when she was in grade school. Porky is on the tennis team and he refuses to join the karuta club. However, Chihaya perceives that Porky still loves karuta, so she challenges him to a match. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: しのぶれど
But I Cannot Hide
Shinoburedo
episode.summary: The karuta club has become an official club. Chihaya announces that the five of them will make it to the national tournament. The beginners, Kana-chan and Desktomu-kun, are worried, but Chihaya shows no mercy. Chihaya is set on making a strong karuta team and aiming for the top. And so, they decided to hold a camp. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: むらさきのゆきしめのゆき
Set These Forbidden Fields Aglow
Murasakino Yuki Shimeno Yuki
episode.summary: After qualifying for the national tournament, the Mizusawa karuta members attempt to bolster their weaknesses. Chihaya and Taichi practice with the Shiranami Society while Porky, Desktomu-kun and Kana-chan practice with the Suihoku Karuta Society. Chihaya is overwhelmed by the pressure of the national tournament, but then she receives support from an unexpected source. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: あまつかぜ
The Sky is the Road Home
Ama tsu Kaze
episode.summary: The Mizusawa karuta club has advanced to the finals to face a regular fixture at the national tournament, Hokuo Academy. As the match begins, Mizusawa is unable to go on the offensive, and Chihaya is distracted when her opponent, Sudo, begins to taunt her. However, she soon learns to play as a team, that every card she takes is a point for the team... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ゆくもかへるもわかれては
Exchange Hellos and Goodbyes
Yuku mo Kaeru mo Wakarete wa
episode.summary: Mizusawa High School karuta club makes its debut at the Tokyo regionals for the national championship. Mizusawa successfully makes it past the group stage. Desk-kun, who was unable to win a single match, feels that he isn`t needed and says that he isn`t going to play. Taichi realizes how Desk-kun feels, so he makes a decision as the club president to bring the team together. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: きみがため
For You, I Head Out
Kimi ga Tame
episode.summary: The Mizusawa High School Karuta Club members visit the Omi Jingu shrine to pray for their victory. However, Chihaya is acting strangely during her match. Meanwhile, Arata reflects upon his separation from karuta and his grandfather as he heads towards Omi Jingu. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: はなよりほかにしるひともなし
For There is No One Else Out Here
Hana yori Hoka ni Shiru Hito mo Nashi
episode.summary: Chihaya has recovered in time for the individual tournament. Players are grouped by their rank, and the youngest Queen in history, Wakamiya Shinobu, is in the Class A bracket, and Chihaya`s second round opponent. Chihaya is overwhelmed by the Queen`s ability and unable to take a single card. As she`s about to give up, she remembers her first match against Arata back in grade school— Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: つらぬきとめぬたまぞちりける
As Though Pearls Have Been Strung Across the Autumn Plain
Tsuranuki Tomenu Tama zo Chiri Keru
episode.summary: Chihaya is helpless against the Queen, but she still manages to take a few cards. But this match has taken her one step closer to understanding what true strength is. Meanwhile, Taichi has advanced to the Class B final. The Mizusawa High School karuta club members have gathered to cheer him on. Taichi has shown that he is willing to move forward, but can he achieve victory? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: HOW TO 競技かるた 入門編
How to Competition Karuta: Introduction Part
How to Kyougi Karuta: Nyuumon Hen
をぐらやま
The Autumn Leaves of Mount Ogura
Ogura Yama
episode.summary: A recap and some animated four-panel comics. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: みちこそなけれ
World Offers No Escape
Michi koso Nakere
episode.summary: The national tournament has ended, and the members of Mizusawa`s karuta club have established some individual goals. Taichi and Porky need to reach Class A. Kana-chan and Desktomu-kun need to start playing in tournaments. And Chihaya is practicing for the East qualifier. However, Dr. Harada suddenly tells Chihaya to stop taking cards with her speed, and she has to rethink how she plays karuta. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: はなぞむかしのかににほひける
The Plum Blossoms Still Smell the Same
Hana zo Mukashi no Ka ni Nioi Keru
episode.summary: Chihaya finally gets to play her first Class A match, while the other members are looking to advance their rank through a strong tournament showing. Chihaya`s opponent Kanai Sakura, who has 35 years of karuta experience. Chihaya is faster, but she has trouble taking cards. Her opponent constantly moves cards into positions that are difficult for her, and Chihaya soon realizes how tough Class A is. Will Chihaya be able to learn something from her match with Sakura? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ながらへば
As the Years Pass
Nagaraeba
episode.summary: The finals have begun. The Class D final is between Kana-chan and Desktomu-kun. The Class B final is between Taichi and Porky. Both finals pit Mizusawa players against each other. Chihaya watches and learns as teammates and rivals battle it out. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: くもゐにまがふおきつしらなみ
The Cresting Waves Almost Look Like Clouds in the Skies
Kumoi ni Magou Oki tsu Shiranami
episode.summary: The Mizusawa High School karuta club is gaining experience by participating in tournaments. However, Chihaya`s grades are so bad that she is no longer allowed to participate, leaving Taichi to attend the next tournament by himself. There, he runs into Arata, who`s returned to karuta. When Taichi and Chihaya see Arata playing karuta... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: わがころもでにゆきはふりつつ
As My Sleeves are Wet with Dew
Waga Koromode ni Yuki wa Furitsutsu
episode.summary: Chihaya is playing in the East Queen qualifier for a chance to face the Queen again. Her first opponent is the grade schooler Ririka, said to be a child prodigy. As Chihaya watches Ririka use speed play karuta, she begins to understand what it means to play karuta without speed. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: うつりにけりないたづらに
Just as My Beauty Has Faded
Utsurini Keri na Itazura ni
episode.summary: Chihaya`s next opponent is the previous Queen, Yamamoto Yumi. Chihaya recalls the previous Queen being a very tenacious player. While Chihaya is fired up for her match against her opponent, Yumi is clearly not as interested in the match, which only serves to enflame Chihaya. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: しろきをみればよぞふけにける
The Night is Nearly Past
Shiroki o Mireba Yo zo Fukeni Keru
episode.summary: Chihaya lost to Yumi by four cards. The loss is a painful one, but after watching Dr. Harada and Tsuboguchi play their hearts out, she realizes she still has much to learn. Meanwhile, Arata lost in the fourth round of the West qualifier. He regrets spending time away from karuta and practices hard to make up. Both of them are learning and taking the next step forward. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: もれいづるつきのかげのさやけさ
Moonlight, Clear and Bright
Moreizuru Tsuki no Kage no Sayakesa
episode.summary: Everybody is shocked after hearing that Master Suo plays karuta with 28 one-syllable cards. Chihaya, Arata, Taichi, and the other karuta club members do some soul searching as they attempt to move forward. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: をのへのさくらさきにけり
Nobody Wishes to See the Beautiful Cherry Blossoms
Onoe no Sakura Sakinikeri
episode.summary: The Mizusawa karuta club is watching the Queen match and Master match at Taichi`s home. The Queen has put on a great deal of weight, which makes it difficult for her to move as Yumi successfully takes cards away from her. Will the Queen be dethroned? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: HOW TO 競技かるた 試合編
How to Competition Karuta: Game Part
How to Kyougi Karuta: Shiai Hen
Opening 1b
Ending 2
HOW TO 競技かるた STEP UP編②
How to Competition Karuta: Step Up Part 2
How to Kyougi Karuta: Step Up Hen (2)
HOW TO 競技かるた STEP UP編①(おてつき&きまり字編)
How to Competition Karuta: Step Up Part 1 (Faults & Kimariji Part)
How to Kyougi Karuta: Step Up Hen (1) (Otetsuki & Kimariji Hen)
Ending 1c
Ending 1b
